tit.j: 阿弥陀寺 (京都市左京区)

sen.j: 阿弥陀寺（あみだじ）は、京都市左京区大原の北側に位置する古知谷にある浄土宗鎮西派の寺院。
sen.e: Amida-ji Temple is a temple belonging to the Chinzei branch of the Pure Land Sect located in Kochidani in the northern part of Ohara, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 山号は光明山、院号は法国院。
sen.e: The honorific mountain prefix is Komyosan and the ingo name is Hokoku-in.

sen.j: 1609年（慶長14年）3月、弾誓上人が開山した念仏道場である。
sen.e: The temple was founded as a Nenbutsu seminay by Priest Tansei in 1609.

sen.j: 1613年（慶長18年）5月23日、開山の弾誓は、当寺の本堂脇の巌窟内で即身仏となった。
sen.e: On the 23rd day of the 5th month of 1613, Tansei underwent sokushinbutsu (the practice causing one's own deaths in a way that results in mummification) in a cave beside the main hall.

sen.j: その後、弾誓の遺体が石棺に納められ、本堂の隣にある石廟に安置された。
sen.e: His remains were later placed inside a stone coffin which was housed within a stone mausoleum next to the main hall.

sen.j: 開山の弾誓を本尊（「植髪 尊像」）として祀っているため、「弾誓仏一流本山」とも呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The temple came to be referred to as "Tanseibutsu Ichiryu-honzan" as the founding priest Tansei serves as the principal image (a statue with implanted hair).

sen.e: On the 4th day of the 2nd month of 1721, Chozen, a Nenbutsu practitioner from Omi Province who visited the temple, also died by sokushinbutsu.
